entries.content: Handle objections by responding in the form of a question to gain clarity or challenge the blanket statement.
Prospect says 'We're fine, thanks'. Agent asks: 'Didn't you mean to say everything's perfect?'
entries.notes: Challenges the 'fine' statement to see if it's truly perfect or if there's room for improvement.

entries.content: Push a general objection to an extreme to test its validity.
entries.notes: Used to see if the prospect's 'no' is absolute or qualified.

entries.content: Prospect says 'I'm not interested'. Agent asks: 'When you say you're not interested, did you mean to say never ever under any circumstances would you consider exploring what we do?'
entries.notes: Pushes 'not interested' to an absolute extreme ('never ever') to force clarification.

entries.content: Prospect says 'We already have a supplier'. Agent asks: 'Would it be fair to say then that there is nothing anyone could say or do... you would never ever consider exploring it or looking into that?'
entries.notes: Challenges the existing supplier objection by pushing to an absolute 'never consider' extreme.

entries.content: Prospect says 'I don't take cold calls'. Agent asks: 'What do you mean?'
entries.notes: Simple question to get the prospect to clarify the specific reason behind the statement.

entries.content: Ask questions to establish if a prospect's statement is a hard fact or a smoke screen to end the call.
entries.notes: The goal is to uncover the true nature of the objection.

focus_area: Handling "Think About It": "What specifically?", Conditional closing
